Pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine containing only polysaccharide antigen, which is a T cell‐independent antigen, can induce serotype‐specific immunoglobulin (Ig)A, IgM, and IgG (mainly IgG2 subclass) antibodies and promote the killing of S pneumoniae by leukocytes and phagocytic cells, thus inducing specific protective effects. Immune responses to capsular polysaccharide are age‐dependent and serotype‐dependent.

62 Antibody levels initially increase after vaccination with PPSV23 and remain elevated for at least 5 years in healthy adults, but they do decline over time.
63 Antibody levels in elderly people tend to decline to approximately baseline level within 7 years after vaccination.
